content: of the front and back sections separated by the 12-stitch saddles repeat the increase row a total of 6 more times for 7 increase row total 28 total stitches increased 124 stitches on the needles the next row is a foundation row for continued shaping across the yoke while increasing stitches along the shoulders you ll place additional markers for yoke shaping proceed as follows k 10 sts pm k to m m1r sm k to m sm m1l k 15 sts pm k 20 sts pm k to m m1r sm k to m sm m1l knit 15 sts pm k to bor 10 sts 4 sts increased 128 sts total there should now be 8 stitch markers on your needles in addition to the bor marker your work should be separated into sections as follows from the bor 10 sts m 16 sts m 12 sts m 16 sts m 20 sts m 16 sts m 12 sts m 16 sts m 10 sts yoke shaping you ll now continue shaping alongside the shoulder saddles and at new sections across the yoke as i worked on this piece it was easiest to think of the front and back sections as triangles or trapezoids separated by the saddle sections you want to work mirrored increases inside those triangles to ensure that either side is sloping evenly towards the hem of the piece work increases across the yoke as follows row 1 *k to m m1r sm k to m m1r sm k 12 sm m1l k to m sm m1l* twice k to bor 8 sts increased row 2-4 k all sts repeat row 1-4 a total of 9 times and then row 1 once more 10 increase row worked for 80 total stitches increased 208 stitches on the needles you ll now work increases at a more gradual rate to continue the domed shape of the poncho work increases as follows row 1-9 k all sts row 10 *k to m m1r sm k to m m1r sm k 12 sm m1l k to m sm m1l* twice k to bor 8 sts increased repeat row 1-10 a total of 4 times 4 increase row worked for 32 total stitches increased 240 stitches on the needles knit 9 row or to desired length in stockinette stitch knit 10 row in 1x1 rib cast off using the italian bind off or your preferred bind off method congrats on your finished poncho/shrug please feel free to tag me on instagram @stitching_stone or tag your work with #sugarloafshrug ~
